steps.title: Go to System Preferences.
steps.content: Go to System Preferences. Click View, then "Language & Text" and the "Input Sources" tab.

steps.title: Find "Russian" and choose one (only one) of the available Russian keyboard layouts.
steps.content: Find "Russian" and choose one (only one) of the available Russian keyboard layouts. For example, "Russian" which is a standard Russian layout for Mac.

steps.title: Switch to Russian typing using ⌘ Cmd+Space.
steps.content: Switch to Russian typing using ⌘ Cmd + Space .

steps.title: Click on the Start button and go to the Control Panel.
steps.content: Click on the Start button and go to the Control Panel. Click on the "Clock, Language, Region" option.

steps.title: Find a tab called "Keyboard and Languages"
steps.content: Find a tab called "Keyboard and Languages"

steps.title: Find "Russian" (language) in the list and then click on its '+' sign to see available layouts.
steps.content: Find "Russian" (language) in the list and then click on its '+' sign to see available layouts. Click on "Russian" in that list of layouts to add it.

steps.title: Click on "Apply" below right.
steps.content: Click on "Apply" below right. Then Windows activates Russian keyboard layout file.

steps.title: Click "OK" again.
steps.content: Click "OK" again. You can now use the buttons Alt + ⇧ Shift to switch between Russian ("RU") and English ("EN"). Now you have standard Russian keyboard layout active and can use it for typing in Russian. Or you can install Phonetic (homophonic) layout when F-Russian F,A-A, O-O,....

steps.title: Download the ER Bukinist KOI8 font.
steps.content: Download the ER Bukinist KOI8 font. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Download the ER Kurier KOI8-R for keyboard layout.
steps.content: Download the ER Kurier KOI8-R for keyboard layout.

steps.title: Select "Help Center" from the Help menu.
steps.content: Select "Help Center" from the Help menu.

steps.title: Check the box at "Russian KOI8-R."
steps.content: Check the box at "Russian KOI8-R." [3] X Research source

steps.title: Select the keyboard layout by clicking on "Russian-KOI8 keyboard."
steps.content: Select the keyboard layout by clicking on "Russian-KOI8 keyboard."

steps.title: Click twice on icon for "Keyboard" to get to the properties for the keyboard.
steps.content: Click twice on icon for "Keyboard" to get to the properties for the keyboard.

steps.title: Select the "Input Locales" tab across the top of the box.
steps.content: Select the "Input Locales" tab across the top of the box.

steps.title: Select the "Add" button to get to the "Add Input Language" screen.
steps.content: Select the "Add" button to get to the "Add Input Language" screen.

steps.title: Select "Input Language" and find and select "Russian" from the list.
steps.content: Select "Input Language" and find and select "Russian" from the list.

steps.title: Leave the "EN English" keyboard as the default.
steps.content: Leave the "EN English" keyboard as the default.

steps.title: Put a check in the "Enable indicator on task bar," bottom of screen.
steps.content: Put a check in the "Enable indicator on task bar," bottom of screen.

steps.title: Click between English and Russian by selecting either on the task bar at the bottom of your screen to the right.
steps.content: Click between English and Russian by selecting either on the task bar at the bottom of your screen to the right.

steps.title: Select "Apply" to ensure that all changes have been accepted and saved.
steps.content: Select "Apply" to ensure that all changes have been accepted and saved.

steps.title: Click on "Start.
steps.content: Click on "Start. "Activate Cyrillic Support in Windows XP

steps.title: Click twice on "Regional and Language Options."
steps.content: Click twice on "Regional and Language Options."

steps.title: Select "Russian" from the drop-down list of languages.
steps.content: Select "Russian" from the drop-down list of languages.

steps.title: Click "Apply"; you will see "RU Russian" in the window.
steps.content: Click "Apply"; you will see "RU Russian" in the window.

steps.title: Select both "Show language..."
steps.content: Select both "Show language..." and "Show additional language..." icons.

steps.title: Select "Key Settings" for the option of switching between languages.
steps.content: Select "Key Settings" for the option of switching between languages.

steps.title: Choose either CTRL or ALT and a numbered key.
steps.content: Choose either CTRL or ALT and a numbered key.

steps.title: Choose either CTRL or ALT and a numbered key to be used to switch to Russian.
steps.content: Choose either CTRL or ALT and a numbered key to be used to switch to Russian.

steps.title: Click on KBDRUPH.Zip to download the layout.
steps.content: Click on KBDRUPH.Zip to download the layout.

steps.title: Unzip the file and designate a folder where the files will be placed.
steps.content: Unzip the file and designate a folder where the files will be placed.

steps.title: Open the folder where the files were placed.
steps.content: Open the folder where the files were placed.

steps.title: Copy KBDRUPH.DLL for Windows 2000 into the WINNT folder in System32.
steps.content: Copy KBDRUPH.DLL for Windows 2000 into the WINNT folder in System32.

steps.title: Copy the file into the Windows folder in System32 for Windows XP.
steps.content: Copy the file into the Windows folder in System32 for Windows XP.

steps.title: Open System32 and click on KBDRUPH.REG.
steps.content: Open System32 and click on KBDRUPH.REG.

steps.title: Click on "Settings" and select a font.
steps.content: Click on "Settings" and select a font.

steps.title: Select "RU Russian" at the bottom on your screen.
steps.content: Select "RU Russian" at the bottom on your screen.
